src:
'SMA GABUNGAN’ Wakili Papua Siap Rebut Piala Kemenpora di Ajang Futsal Championship 2019
07 Nov 2019, 23:13 by Susi Lintang



'SMA GABUNGAN’ Wakili Papua Siap Rebut Piala Kemenpora di Ajang Futsal Championship 2019



'SMA GABUNGAN’ Wakili Papua Siap Rebut Piala Kemenpora di Ajang Futsal Championship 2019


KBRN, Jakarta : Tim Futsal SMA Gabungan Jayapura mewakili Prov. Papua maju ke Tingkat Nasional ‘Grand Pocari Sweat Futsal Championship 2019’ memperebutkan Piala Kementerian Pemuda dan Olah Raga (KEMENPORA) ke 10 yang diselenggarakan tanggal 8 sampai 10 November 2019, di Istora Senayan Jakarta.
Pada babak kualifikasi, Tim Futsal SMA Gabungan berhasil meraih kemenangan di kejuaraan Pocari Sweat Futsal tingkat Provinsi, setelah mengungguli 23 Tim Futsal SMA/sederajat di wilayah Papua, diantaranya, kota Jayapura, kab. Keerom, kab. Jayapura, perwakilan Wamena, dan Mimika.
“Untuk grand persiapan kita cuma punya waktu 1 minggu 3 hari, kita fokuskan latihan anak-anak pagi sore, dan kita sudah pastikan anak-anak memang sudah siap tampil ke grand championship,” tutur Manajer Tim Futsal SMA Gabungan Jayapura, Roulnick Bebeto Makamur, saat dihubungi Radio Republik Indonesia (RRI), Kamis (7/11/2019).
“Karena persiapan tidak terlalu lama, seperti daerah lain yang sudah lama main duluan, persiapan pun lebih lama dan juga tim-tim terbaik, namun tidak menutup kemungkinan target kita sampai ke semi final atau akan membuat kejutan menang, seperti waktu di tingkat regional, kita buat kejutan buat penonton,” tambahnya.
Lebih lanjut dikatakan, jika target itu tidak tercapai, maka akan melakukan evaluasi, menurutnya karena berbeda permainan pada saat di regional/daerah dan nasional, beda pula karakter permainan di Papua dengan di Jawa, apalagi futsal lahirnya di pulau Jawa dan lebih paham tentang permainan futsal, tidak menutup kemungkinan Tim SMA Gabungan Jayapura akan berbuat yang terbaik.
Di babak Grand Champions 2019 ini diikuti oleh 19 Tim Nasional, sedangkan kekuatan Tim Futsal SMA Gabungan, terdiri dari pemain dan official,
Billy Hutagalung (kiper), Migel Wayoi (kiper), Denilson Rawar (capten), Ones Bonay, Juan Kalem, Gian Marani, Alamsyah Rewang, Aurilie Lewerissa, Thomas Karubaba, Cristofel Capitan, Paulus Duwiri, Juwan Misah. Martinus Rontini (Pelatih), Frans Daniel Sinanu (Asisten Pelatih), Roulnick Bebeto Makamur (Manajer), Sandra Titihalawa (Kepsek), Petronela Tetelepta (Waka Kesiswaan).
text:
'JOINT HIGH SCHOOL' Represents Papua Ready to Seize the Kemenpora Cup in the 2019 Futsal Championship
Nov 7 2019, 23:13 by Susi Lintang



'JOINT HIGH SCHOOL' Represents Papua Ready to Seize the Kemenpora Cup in the 2019 Futsal Championship



'JOINT HIGH SCHOOL' Represents Papua Ready to Seize the Kemenpora Cup in the 2019 Futsal Championship


KBRN, Jakarta: Jayapura Joint Senior High School Futsal Team representing Prov. Papua advances to the National Level '2019 Grand Pocari Sweat Futsal Championship' for the 10th Ministry of Youth and Sports Cup (KEMENPORA) held on 8 to 10 November 2019, at Istora Senayan Jakarta.
In the qualification round, the Combined High School Futsal Team won the provincial level Pocari Sweat Futsal Championship, having outperformed 23 High School / equivalent Futsal Teams in the Papua region, including, Jayapura city, regency. Keerom, kab. Jayapura, representatives of Wamena and Mimika.
"For the grand preparations, we only have 1 week and 3 days, we focus on the children's training in the morning and in the afternoon, and we have confirmed that the children are indeed ready to appear to the grand championship," said the Manager of the Combined Jayapura High School Futsal Team, Roulnick Bebeto Makamur, when contacted by the Republic of Indonesia Radio (RRI), Thursday (11/07/2019).
"Because the preparation is not too long, like other regions that have played for a long time, the preparation takes longer and also the best teams, but it does not rule out our target reaching the semi-finals or will make a surprise win, like time at the regional level, we make a surprise to the audience, "he added.
He further said, if the target was not achieved, then he would conduct an evaluation, according to him because the game was different at the regional / regional and national levels, the character of the game in Papua was different from in Java, especially since futsal was born on the island of Java and understood more about futsal. , did not rule out the Jayapura Joint High School Team will do their best.
In the 2019 Grand Champions round, 19 National Teams were participated in, while the Combined High School Futsal Team, consisting of players and officials,
Billy Hutagalung (goalkeeper), Migel Wayoi (goalkeeper), Denilson Rawar (captain), Ones Bonay, Juan Kalem, Gian Marani, Alamsyah Rewang, Aurilie Lewerissa, Thomas Karubaba, Cristofel Capitan, Paulus Duwiri, Juwan Misah. Martinus Rontini (Coach), Frans Daniel Sinanu (Assistant Coach), Roulnick Bebeto Makamur (Manager), Sandra Titihalawa (Principal), Petronela Tetelepta (Student Waka).
